Occams Advisory was founded in 2012 to meet this need as a one-stop firm that serves (MSME's) worldwide. Mission & Values
Responsible and ethical business is our way of conducting business. We contribute to climate change and environmental preservation. Our endeavor is to create positive changes to business and society as a whole, with guidance from our values and principles. Commitment to responsible business practices is invariably prioritized. We are building motivated teams by considering our promises to collaboration, diversification, and inclusion. Our team has developed a successful step-by-step process. We incorporate people with exceptional talents, abilities, and potential into an environment which enhances personal growth to apex levels. Our success in attracting and retaining high quality and diverse talent, is a reflection of our outreach to the global societies in which we all live and work.

content:
Founded in 2012, Occams Advisory has fulfilled an unmet need – the need for small businesses to have access to an affordable, one-stop shop for strategic advisory and functional services. Through the founder’s own entrepreneurial experiences, as well as from client feedback, Occams Advisory was created, from day one, to serve the small business market by addressing the most pressing needs of entrepreneurs.
Our name is inspired by the principle of Occams Razor, propounded by William of Occam (1288-1348 AD), an English Franciscan friar and scholastic philosopher. Occams Razor is a line of reasoning that says the simplest answer is often correct. Occams Advisory uses this spirit of problem-solving to provide simple solutions to complex problems, focusing on tangible results, measurable impact and continuous improvement.
Let's Partner
Our Philosophies

Our Philosophies
“Through our observations and learnings, we have created a logical and sequential O.C.C.A.M.S set of Values and Principles, across Emotional, Intellectual and Physical dimensions that human beings operate in. Our beliefs are grounded in latest and most advanced scientific research that explore the effects that emotions have on our entire being originating from cells in particular, on our chromosomes and mitochondrial DNA. Leading scientists and neurologists have aligned to conclude that our emotions can shape our physical reality at the molecular level. Hence, we at Occams emphasize upon Emotions: Feelings as the single most critical building block of Intellect: Thinking which drives and executes our Physical: Being.
Click on the Trinity of O.C.C.A.M.S. philosophies that lay out our model of an ideal individual, intellectual and professional.”

Our Impact
In a world where over a billion people suffer from malnutrition, and even more lack access to clean water, the challenges are immense. About one child in every five receives no education and is at risk. With the world's population set to grow by at least two billion over the next three decades, primarily in the developing world, these challenges can compound. At Occams Advisory, we take the right action by partnering with organizations like blossomprojects.org to implement preventative and remedial steps, working toward a brighter future for all.

Overview
Business Services & Growth Incubation
Our Business Services & Growth Incubation provides start-ups and small businesses growth incubation and essential business services. We foster the development of early-stage ventures by providing business services and resources. In addition to the much-needed guidance to emerging entrepreneurs, Occams’ BSGI provides essential business services such as financial Accounting Advisory, Structuring & Incorporation, Human Capital Advisory (HCA), Marketing & Branding Services (MBS) under a subscription model. HCA is of specific importance as start-ups find it difficult to attract and retain talent. Occams HCA offers highly customized solutions for our clients’ diverse needs. Hiring and retaining quality talent is arguably the greatest responsibility of management and Occams has helped several of its clients achieve exceptional results.

content: Title: THE POWER BEHIND THE SCENES - Occams Advisory is the premier, full-service advisory firm for small business clients focused towards tax planning and advisory.

metadata.title: THE POWER BEHIND THE SCENES - Occams Advisory is the premier, full-service advisory firm for small business clients focused towards tax planning and advisory.

content:
THE POWER BEHIND THE SCENES
by Varun Kumar | May 20, 2025 | Blogs | 0 comments
Blog At A Glance:
Introduction
Role of Backend Customer Support in Financial Organizations
Beyond the Frontlines: What Backend Support Really Does
Why Backend Teams are Critical to Client Trust
Growth and Competitive Edge Through Strong Backend Operations
Key Takeaways
1. Introduction
In the financial services industry, client experience can make or break a company’s reputation. While front-end representatives often receive the spotlight, it is the backend customer support team that ensures seamless service delivery, accurate transactions, and prompt client communication.
A strong backend team not only supports growth but also safeguards client trust — an invaluable asset for any financial organization.
2. Role of Backend Customer Support in Financial Organizations

metadata.title: THE POWER BEHIND THE SCENES - Occams Advisory is the premier, full-service advisory firm for small business clients focused towards tax planning and advisory.

content:
A strong backend team not only supports growth but also safeguards client trust — an invaluable asset for any financial organization.
2. Role of Backend Customer Support in Financial Organizations
In the world of financial services, client experience isn’t just important — it’s everything. While much attention is often lavished on front-facing roles such as relationship managers and advisors, the reality is that backend customer support teams are the unsung heroes ensuring seamless, trustworthy service delivery. They are the silent force fortifying a financial institution’s reputation and fuels sustainable growth.
3. Beyond the Frontlines: What Backend Support Really Does
In a financial organization, backend customer support encompasses a wide range of vital activities:
A. Transaction Processing: Verifying, approving, and ensuring accuracy in every client transaction.

metadata.title: THE POWER BEHIND THE SCENES - Occams Advisory is the premier, full-service advisory firm for small business clients focused towards tax planning and advisory.

content:
In a financial organization, backend customer support encompasses a wide range of vital activities:
A. Transaction Processing: Verifying, approving, and ensuring accuracy in every client transaction.
B. Account Management: Keeping client information updated and secure, ensuring compliance with regulations like KYC (Know Your Customer) and AML (Anti-Money Laundering).
C. Issue Resolution: Handling escalations that front-end teams cannot resolve immediately, often involving deep investigations.
D. System Maintenance: Supporting CRM systems, banking platforms, and the communication channels clients interact with daily.
E. Regulatory Compliance: Maintaining records, generating reports, and preparing for audits to ensure the organization operates within legal frameworks.
Each of these functions has a direct or indirect impact on the client’s trust in the institution.
Why Backend Teams are Critical to Client Trust

metadata.title: THE POWER BEHIND THE SCENES - Occams Advisory is the premier, full-service advisory firm for small business clients focused towards tax planning and advisory.

content:
Each of these functions has a direct or indirect impact on the client’s trust in the institution.
Why Backend Teams are Critical to Client Trust
Financial organizations are entrusted with clients’ most valuable assets: their money, data, and peace of mind. Any error — a delayed transaction, a miscommunication, a lost document — can shake client confidence and even lead to regulatory penalties.
Backend teams ensure that:
A. Accuracy is non-negotiable. Every transfer, statement, and balance check must be flawless.
B. Speed meets expectations. In an era of instant banking, backend teams help deliver real-time services.
C. Transparency is maintained. Backend support provides reliable records and clear communication that clients can depend on.
D. Security remains robust. Behind every safe online transaction is a vigilant backend team safeguarding against fraud and breaches.
Growth and Competitive Edge Through Strong Backend Operations

metadata.title: THE POWER BEHIND THE SCENES - Occams Advisory is the premier, full-service advisory firm for small business clients focused towards tax planning and advisory.

content:
D. Security remains robust. Behind every safe online transaction is a vigilant backend team safeguarding against fraud and breaches.
Growth and Competitive Edge Through Strong Backend Operations
A strong backend doesn’t just protect a company — it enables growth. When financial services run smoothly:
A. Clients experience fewer friction points, boosting satisfaction and loyalty.
B. Frontline teams can focus more on relationship-building rather than troubleshooting.
C. The company has a reputation for reliability and professionalism, standing out in a competitive market.
Moreover, a streamlined backend operation makes it easier to scale services, integrate new technologies like AI-driven insights, and quickly adapt to regulatory changes.
Final Thoughts

metadata.title: THE POWER BEHIND THE SCENES - Occams Advisory is the premier, full-service advisory firm for small business clients focused towards tax planning and advisory.

content:
Moreover, a streamlined backend operation makes it easier to scale services, integrate new technologies like AI-driven insights, and quickly adapt to regulatory changes.
Final Thoughts
In today’s hyper-connected financial landscape, backend customer support is no longer a behind-the-scenes function — it is a core pillar of client experience and trust. Financial organizations that recognize and invest in their backend teams will not only safeguard their reputations but also create powerful engines for long-term growth.
If we truly want to elevate client experience in financial services, it’s time to shine a light on the teams working quietly but critically in the background.
4. Why It’s Critical for Growth and Client Retention

metadata.title: THE POWER BEHIND THE SCENES - Occams Advisory is the premier, full-service advisory firm for small business clients focused towards tax planning and advisory.

content:
4. Why It’s Critical for Growth and Client Retention
In today’s fiercely competitive financial services landscape, client expectations are higher than ever. They demand fast, flawless service — and they have plenty of alternatives if a company falls short. While much of the industry’s focus remains on customer acquisition, the real battle for long-term success is fought behind the scenes. Specifically, in the strength and agility of the backend customer support teams.
A well-oiled backend operation isn’t just a “nice-to-have” — it’s a critical driver for growth and client retention. Here’s why:
A. The Foundation of Seamless Client Experience
First impressions may bring clients through the door, but it’s consistent service excellence that keeps them. Backend support ensures:
Accurate transaction processing
Quick issue resolution
Secure account management
Clear and timely communication

metadata.title: THE POWER BEHIND THE SCENES - Occams Advisory is the premier, full-service advisory firm for small business clients focused towards tax planning and advisory.

content:
Accurate transaction processing
Quick issue resolution
Secure account management
Clear and timely communication
When backend processes run smoothly, clients experience fewer frustrations. Every successful account update, seamless transaction, and timely response builds trust — a currency more valuable than money in financial relationships.
B. Trust is Built in the Background
Financial services deal with a client’s most sensitive assets — money and personal information. Mistakes in these areas can lead to not just financial losses, but broken trust that’s nearly impossible to rebuild.
Backend teams:
Prevent errors before they reach the client
Safeguard against fraud and security breaches
Ensure compliance with regulatory standards (such as GDPR, KYC, and AML regulations)
When clients see their transactions processed correctly and their data handled responsibly, loyalty naturally follows.
C. Scalability for Sustainable Growth

metadata.title: THE POWER BEHIND THE SCENES - Occams Advisory is the premier, full-service advisory firm for small business clients focused towards tax planning and advisory.

content:
When clients see their transactions processed correctly and their data handled responsibly, loyalty naturally follows.
C. Scalability for Sustainable Growth
As financial organizations expand — whether through new products, new markets, or digital innovation — the backend must scale with them.
A strong backend operation:
Supports higher client volumes without sacrificing service quality
Adapts quickly to new technologies and client demands
Maintains service consistency across multiple channels and locations
Without a scalable backend, growth efforts can falter, resulting in service breakdowns and client churn.
D. Enhancing the Frontline Teams
Backend teams empower customer-facing employees to focus on relationship-building instead of troubleshooting.
When frontline advisors and representatives can trust that backend operations will deliver, they can:
Personalize interactions
Proactively meet client needs
Focus on upselling and cross-selling opportunities

Identify service bottlenecks
Detect patterns in client behavior
Predict churn risks before they materialize

In financial organizations, backend customer support isn’t an auxiliary function — it’s a strategic necessity.

metadata.title: Optimizing Client Relations with AI in 2025 - Occams Advisory is the premier, full-service advisory firm for small business clients focused towards tax planning and advisory.

content:
Optimizing Client Relations with AI in 2025
by Maria Antonio | Apr 28, 2025 | Blogs | 0 comments
Blog At A Glance:
Introduction
Customer Experience: The New Competitive Advantage
The Strategic Path Forward
Final Thoughts
Introduction
In today’s ultra-competitive market, where businesses are often offering similar products or services, one thing increasingly sets companies apart — the client experience. Gone are the days when quality and price alone could guarantee customer loyalty. In 2025, success lies in delivering exceptional, personalized, and seamless interactions at every touchpoint. And to achieve that, forward-thinking businesses are embracing artificial intelligence (AI) not just for efficiency — but to completely transform the way they serve, retain, and grow their client base.
We are no longer asking if AI should be part of your client experience strategy. The question now is how well you’re using it.
Customer Experience: The New Competitive Advantage

metadata.title: Optimizing Client Relations with AI in 2025 - Occams Advisory is the premier, full-service advisory firm for small business clients focused towards tax planning and advisory.

content:
We are no longer asking if AI should be part of your client experience strategy. The question now is how well you’re using it.
Customer Experience: The New Competitive Advantage
“Delivering an exceptional customer experience is now essential for companies of every kind, regardless of size or sector.”
In the past, customer service was reactive — something that happened when a client reached out with a question or complaint. But AI has turned the model upside down. It enables businesses to proactively understand client needs, tailor communications, and identify friction points before they escalate. More importantly, AI helps us enhance — not replace — the human connection.
With AI, we’re no longer guessing what a client might want or need. We’re predicting it, understanding it, and designing entire experiences around it.
1. Smarter Engagement with AI-Powered Insights

metadata.title: Optimizing Client Relations with AI in 2025 - Occams Advisory is the premier, full-service advisory firm for small business clients focused towards tax planning and advisory.

content:
With AI, we’re no longer guessing what a client might want or need. We’re predicting it, understanding it, and designing entire experiences around it.
1. Smarter Engagement with AI-Powered Insights
Client relationships thrive on personalization. The more deeply you understand your client, the better equipped you are to serve them. AI gives us the ability to develop a comprehensive, 360-degree view of each client by analyzing communication patterns, transaction histories, behavior across platforms, and service interactions.
✅ Real-time sentiment analysis enables teams to detect dissatisfaction or disengagement — even when clients don’t explicitly say something is wrong. Subtle changes in language, tone, or behavior are flagged, helping teams step in before issues escalate.

metadata.title: Optimizing Client Relations with AI in 2025 - Occams Advisory is the premier, full-service advisory firm for small business clients focused towards tax planning and advisory.

content:
✅ Predictive modeling helps identify clients who may be at risk of churning or those who could benefit from a new service. This allows for timely, personalized outreach that positions your firm as proactive and client focused.
✅ AI-optimized communications ensure the right message is delivered at the right time — increasing engagement, improving response rates, and fostering deeper loyalty.
According to McKinsey’s 2025 State of AI in Consulting report, firms that adopted predictive client engagement strategies saw a 30–50% improvement in client retention and a 25% increase in cross-sell success within the first year.
The net effect? You’re not just responding to client needs — you’re anticipating them and delivering value before it’s requested. That’s what transforms service into strategy.
2. Streamlined Client Onboarding and Communication
First impressions are everything. A clunky or impersonal onboarding process can quickly erode trust. But AI is changing the game here, too.

metadata.title: Optimizing Client Relations with AI in 2025 - Occams Advisory is the premier, full-service advisory firm for small business clients focused towards tax planning and advisory.

content:
2. Streamlined Client Onboarding and Communication
First impressions are everything. A clunky or impersonal onboarding process can quickly erode trust. But AI is changing the game here, too.
Automated onboarding tools powered by AI can handle initial document collection, frequently asked questions, and scheduling needs — all while maintaining a personalized feel. Natural language processing allows chatbots to interact with clients in human-like ways, offering helpful, context-aware responses that make clients feel attended to.
Meanwhile, AI-enhanced customer relationship management (CRM) systems intelligently prioritize outreach. For example, a client requesting urgent support can be flagged and elevated automatically, ensuring they’re not buried in a queue. AI can even recommend when to reach out, what to say, and which channel is most likely to get a response.

metadata.title: Optimizing Client Relations with AI in 2025 - Occams Advisory is the premier, full-service advisory firm for small business clients focused towards tax planning and advisory.

content:
By reducing administrative friction and allowing human agents to focus on higher-value interactions, AI delivers faster, smoother, and more consistent client communication.
Clients don’t want more emails. They want the right message at the right time. AI delivers that.
3. Delivering Consistency Across All Touchpoints
One of the biggest challenges in client relations — especially for firms with distributed teams or multiple communication channels — is maintaining a consistent voice and experience.
Inconsistent service isn’t just confusing for clients; it’s frustrating. One great interaction can be quickly undermined by a disorganized or off-brand follow-up. AI helps address this through intelligent quality control and content standardization.

metadata.title: Optimizing Client Relations with AI in 2025 - Occams Advisory is the premier, full-service advisory firm for small business clients focused towards tax planning and advisory.

content:
✅ Natural language processing (NLP) ensures every communication aligns with your brand’s tone, compliance standards, and client expectations. It can scan messages for errors, suggest improvements, and ensure that your team’s communication is polished and on-message.
✅ AI-enabled knowledge bases make it easy for team members to access the same source of truth, ensuring accurate and aligned answers across departments.
✅ Automated workflows ensure that no task falls through the cracks — from proposal delivery to service follow-up, everything is tracked and managed consistently.
This level of consistency, at scale, is something only AI can deliver — and it’s critical for building long-term client trust.
4. Enhancing Trust Through Data Transparency

metadata.title: Optimizing Client Relations with AI in 2025 - Occams Advisory is the premier, full-service advisory firm for small business clients focused towards tax planning and advisory.

content:
This level of consistency, at scale, is something only AI can deliver — and it’s critical for building long-term client trust.
4. Enhancing Trust Through Data Transparency
Today’s clients are data-savvy and expect transparency. They want to know what’s happening behind the scenes: where their project stands, what’s next, and when to expect results. They don’t want to chase updates — they want to be looped in effortlessly.
AI-driven dashboards and self-service portals are revolutionizing how clients access information. These tools offer real-time status updates on deliverables, timelines, documents, and even billing — giving clients a sense of control and clarity.
This type of transparency fosters deeper trust and reduces the need for manual follow-ups. When clients can see progress for themselves, they’re more confident in your team’s performance — and more likely to recommend your services.
In this sense, transparency is more than good service. It’s a trust multiplier.

metadata.title: Optimizing Client Relations with AI in 2025 - Occams Advisory is the premier, full-service advisory firm for small business clients focused towards tax planning and advisory.

content:
In this sense, transparency is more than good service. It’s a trust multiplier.
5. Tangible Benefits of AI in Client Relations
Let’s recap the biggest advantages:
✅ Increased Efficiency
AI automates repetitive tasks like appointment scheduling, email follow-ups, and data entry, freeing human teams to focus on strategy, empathy, and high-stakes interactions.
✅ Enhanced Personalization
By analyzing data at scale, AI enables teams to craft individualized experiences that resonate. Tailored suggestions, proactive support, and timely engagement deepen client loyalty.
✅ Cost Savings
Reducing manual work doesn’t just boost efficiency — it cuts costs. From onboarding to support, AI streamlines processes without sacrificing quality.
✅ Better Decision-Making
Data-driven insights inform better strategies. Whether it’s identifying at-risk clients or tracking satisfaction trends, AI turns raw data into meaningful action.
✅ Stronger Client Retention

metadata.title: Optimizing Client Relations with AI in 2025 - Occams Advisory is the premier, full-service advisory firm for small business clients focused towards tax planning and advisory.

content:
Data-driven insights inform better strategies. Whether it’s identifying at-risk clients or tracking satisfaction trends, AI turns raw data into meaningful action.
✅ Stronger Client Retention
By flagging issues early and offering proactive support, AI helps prevent churn and ensures that every client feels seen, valued, and supported.
The Strategic Path Forward
AI is not a plug-and-play solution — it’s a tool that must be strategically deployed. Companies that succeed in using AI for client relations are those that align it with their broader business goals.
Here are some best practices to ensure success:
✅ Start with Clear Objectives
Know what you want to achieve — whether it’s reducing response time, increasing satisfaction scores, or boosting retention. AI is most effective when it’s directed toward specific, measurable goals.
✅ Leverage Data Wisely

metadata.title: Optimizing Client Relations with AI in 2025 - Occams Advisory is the premier, full-service advisory firm for small business clients focused towards tax planning and advisory.

content:
✅ Leverage Data Wisely
AI is only as good as the data it’s trained on. Prioritize data integrity and create processes for continuous data enrichment. Invest in systems that capture the full breadth of client interactions.
✅ Balance Automation and Empathy
AI can answer questions — but only people can build relationships. Use automation to support your team, not replace them. For complex or emotional issues, always ensure a human is available to step in.
✅ Monitor, Learn, Adapt
Don’t set it and forget it. AI strategies must evolve with your clients. Monitor feedback, run A/B tests, and adjust workflows regularly to stay ahead of changing expectations.
✅ Be Transparent
Let clients know how AI is used and what data is being collected. Transparency reinforces trust and positions your business as a responsible, client-first organization.
Final Thoughts: The Future Is Personal, Predictive, and Proactive

metadata.title: Optimizing Client Relations with AI in 2025 - Occams Advisory is the premier, full-service advisory firm for small business clients focused towards tax planning and advisory.

content:
Final Thoughts: The Future Is Personal, Predictive, and Proactive
AI is no longer the future — it’s the present. But it’s also evolving fast. Companies who integrate AI into their client strategy now will lead the market tomorrow.
The best client experiences aren’t reactive. They’re consistent, data-informed, and built entirely around the client’s needs. That’s where AI excels. It helps us reimagine how we listen, serve, and connect — and that’s the key to deeper loyalty and long-term value.
Now is the time to reimagine your client relationships — not with more tools, but with smarter ones.
Let’s optimize — not just for efficiency, but for experience.
Written by Maria Antonio, VP- Client Relations.

content: Title: Qualified Expenses for the R&D Tax Credit

metadata.title: Qualified Expenses for the R&D Tax Credit
metadata.meta_description: Learn about the qualified expenses for the R&D tax credit in our expert blog post. We provide real-life examples and FAQs to help you maximize your tax savings.

content:
Qualified expenses for the R&D tax credit
by Occams Marketing | Feb 23, 2023 | Blogs, News, RECENT ARTICLES | 0 comments
Qualified Expenses for the R&D Tax Credit
The Research and Development (R&D) Tax Credit is a valuable tax credit that rewards businesses for investing in innovation. However, many businesses are unsure of what expenses qualify for this credit. In this blog post, we’ll explore the qualified expenses for the R&D Tax Credit and provide expert guidance on how to maximize your tax savings.
Introduction
The R&D Tax Credit is a federal tax credit designed to encourage businesses to invest in research and development activities. This credit can provide significant tax savings for businesses that invest in innovation.
What is the R&D Tax Credit?
The R&D Tax Credit is a federal tax credit that rewards businesses for investing in research and development activities. This credit is available to businesses of all sizes and can provide significant tax savings.

metadata.title: Qualified Expenses for the R&D Tax Credit
metadata.meta_description: Learn about the qualified expenses for the R&D tax credit in our expert blog post. We provide real-life examples and FAQs to help you maximize your tax savings.

content:
Qualified Expenses for the R&D Tax Credit
To qualify for the R&D Tax Credit, businesses must incur expenses related to qualified research activities. These expenses can include wages paid to employees performing qualified research, supplies used in qualified research, and contract research expenses paid to third-party contractors.
It’s important to note that not all research and development activities qualify for the R&D Tax Credit. To be eligible, the research must meet certain criteria, including being undertaken to create new or improved products or processes and involving a process of experimentation.
Real-Life Scenarios
Here are two real-life scenarios that demonstrate how businesses can qualify for the R&D Tax Credit:

metadata.title: Qualified Expenses for the R&D Tax Credit
metadata.meta_description: Learn about the qualified expenses for the R&D tax credit in our expert blog post. We provide real-life examples and FAQs to help you maximize your tax savings.

content:
Real-Life Scenarios
Here are two real-life scenarios that demonstrate how businesses can qualify for the R&D Tax Credit:
Scenario 1: ABC Company is a software company that invests in developing a new software application to improve its existing product line. During the development process, ABC Company incurs wages, supplies, and third-party contractor expenses related to qualified research activities. These expenses qualify for the R&D Tax Credit, resulting in significant tax savings for the company.
Scenario 2: XYZ Company is a manufacturer that invests in improving its manufacturing process to increase efficiency and reduce waste. The improvements involve a process of experimentation and result in new or improved products. XYZ Company incurs wages and supply expenses related to qualified research activities, which qualify for the R&D Tax Credit.
Conclusion

metadata.title: Qualified Expenses for the R&D Tax Credit
metadata.meta_description: Learn about the qualified expenses for the R&D tax credit in our expert blog post. We provide real-life examples and FAQs to help you maximize your tax savings.

content:
Conclusion
The R&D Tax Credit is a valuable tax credit that can provide significant tax savings for businesses that invest in research and development activities. By understanding the qualified expenses for this credit and consulting with a tax advisor, businesses can maximize their tax savings and invest in innovation.
Schedule a no-obligation, no cost call with the professional experts at Occams to help drive solutions for your business.

content:

Website Privacy Policy
Last modified: July 17, 2022
Introduction
Occams Advisory (“Company” or “We”) respect your privacy and are committed to protecting it through our compliance with this policy.
This policy describes the types of information we may collect from you or that you may provide when you visit the website occamsadvisory.com (our “Website“) and our practices for collecting, using, maintaining, protecting, and disclosing that information.
This policy applies to information we collect:
On this Website.
In email, text, and other electronic messages between you and this Website.
It does not apply to information collected by:
Us offline or through any other means, including on any other website operated by Company or any third party; or
Any third party, including through any application or content (including advertising) that may link to or be accessible from or on the Website.

metadata.title: Privacy Policy | Occams Advisory

content:
Any third party, including through any application or content (including advertising) that may link to or be accessible from or on the Website.
Please read this policy carefully to understand our policies and practices regarding your information and how we will treat it. If you do not agree with our policies and practices, your choice is not to use our Website. By accessing or using this Website, you agree to this privacy policy. This policy may change from time to time (see Changes to Our Privacy Policy). Your continued use of this Website after we make changes is deemed to be acceptance of those changes, so please check the policy periodically for updates.
Children Under the Age of 13

metadata.title: Privacy Policy | Occams Advisory

content:
Children Under the Age of 13
Our Website is not intended for children under 13 years of age. No one under age 13 may provide any information to or on the Website. We do not knowingly collect personal information from children under 13. If you are under 13, do not use or provide any information on this Website or on or through any of its features or register on the Website, make any purchases through the Website, use any of the interactive or public comment features of this Website or provide any information about yourself to us, including your name, address, telephone number, email address, or any screen name or user name you may use. If we learn we have collected or received personal information from a child under 13 without verification of parental consent, we will delete that information. If you believe we might have any information from or about a child under 13, please contact us at:

metadata.title: Privacy Policy | Occams Advisory

content:
California residents under 16 years of age may have additional rights regarding the collection and sale of their personal information. Please see Your California Privacy Rights for more information.
Information We Collect About You and How We Collect It
We collect several types of information from and about users of our Website, including information:
By which you may be personally identified, such as name, postal address, e-mail address, telephone number, or any other identifier by which you may be contacted online or offline (“personal information“);
That is about you but individually does not identify you; and/or
About your internet connection, the equipment you use to access our Website, and usage details.
Information You Provide to Us.
The information we collect on or through our Website may include:

metadata.title: Privacy Policy | Occams Advisory

content:
About your internet connection, the equipment you use to access our Website, and usage details.
Information You Provide to Us.
The information we collect on or through our Website may include:
Information that you provide by filling in forms on our Website. This includes information provided at the time of registering to use our Website, subscribing to our service, posting material, or requesting further services. We may also ask you for information when you enter a contest or promotion sponsored by us, and when you report a problem with our Website.
Records and copies of your correspondence (including email addresses), if you contact us.
Your responses to surveys that we might ask you to complete for research purposes.
Details of transactions you carry out through our Website and of the fulfillment of your orders. You may be required to provide financial information before placing an order through our Website
Your search queries on the Website.

metadata.title: Privacy Policy | Occams Advisory

content:
Your search queries on the Website.
You also may provide information to be published or displayed (hereinafter, “posted“) on public areas of the Website, or transmitted to other users of the Website or third parties (collectively, “User Contributions“). Your User Contributions are posted on and transmitted to others at your own risk. Although we limit access to certain pages, please be aware that no security measures are perfect or impenetrable. Additionally, we cannot control the actions of other users of the Website with whom you may choose to share your User Contributions. Therefore, we cannot and do not guarantee that your User Contributions will not be viewed by unauthorized persons.
Information We Collect Through Automatic Data Collection Technologies.
As you navigate through and interact with our Website, we may use automatic data collection technologies to collect certain information about your equipment, browsing actions, and patterns, including:

metadata.title: Privacy Policy | Occams Advisory

content:
Details of your visits to our Website, including traffic data, location data, logs, and other communication data and the resources that you access and use on the Website.
Information about your computer and internet connection, including your IP address, operating system, and browser type.
The information we collect automatically may include personal information, or we may maintain it or associate it with personal information we collect in other ways or receive from third parties. It helps us to improve our Website and to deliver a better and more personalized service, including by enabling us to:
Estimate our audience size and usage patterns.
Store information about your preferences, allowing us to customize our Website according to your individual interests.
Speed up your searches.
Recognize you when you return to our Website.
The technologies we use for this automatic data collection may include:

metadata.title: Privacy Policy | Occams Advisory

content:
Speed up your searches.
Recognize you when you return to our Website.
The technologies we use for this automatic data collection may include:
Cookies (or browser cookies). A cookie is a small file placed on the hard drive of your computer. You may refuse to accept browser cookies by activating the appropriate setting on your browser. However, if you select this setting you may be unable to access certain parts of our Website. Unless you have adjusted your browser setting so that it will refuse cookies, our system will issue cookies when you direct your browser to our Website.

metadata.title: Privacy Policy | Occams Advisory

content:
Flash Cookies. Certain features of our Website may use local stored objects (or Flash cookies) to collect and store information about your preferences and navigation to, from, and on our Website. Flash cookies are not managed by the same browser settings as are used for browser cookies. For information about managing your privacy and security settings for Flash cookies, see Choices About How We Use and Disclose Your Information.
Third-Party Use of Cookies and Other Tracking Technologies

metadata.title: Privacy Policy | Occams Advisory

content:
Third-Party Use of Cookies and Other Tracking Technologies
Some content or applications, including advertisements, on the Website are served by third-parties, including advertisers, ad networks and servers, content providers, and application providers. These third parties may use cookies alone or in conjunction with web beacons or other tracking technologies to collect information about you when you use our website. The information they collect may be associated with your personal information or they may collect information, including personal information, about your online activities over time and across different websites and other online services. They may use this information to provide you with interest-based (behavioral) advertising or other targeted content.

metadata.title: Privacy Policy | Occams Advisory

content:
We do not control these third parties’ tracking technologies or how they may be used. If you have any questions about an advertisement or other targeted content, you should contact the responsible provider directly. For information about how you can opt out of receiving targeted advertising from many providers, see Choices About How We Use and Disclose Your Information.
How We Use Your Information
We use information that we collect about you or that you provide to us, including any personal information:
To present our Website and its contents to you.
To provide you with information, products, or services that you request from us.
To send tailored information, news and other notifications related to your business.
To fulfill any other purpose for which you provide it.
To provide you with notices about your account, including expiration and renewal notices.

metadata.title: Privacy Policy | Occams Advisory

content:
To fulfill any other purpose for which you provide it.
To provide you with notices about your account, including expiration and renewal notices.
To carry out our obligations and enforce our rights arising from any contracts entered into between you and us, including for billing and collection.
To notify you about changes to our Website or any products or services we offer or provide though it.
To allow you to participate in interactive features on our Website.
In any other way we may describe when you provide the information.
For any other purpose with your consent.
We may also use your information to contact you about our own and third-parties’ goods and services that may be of interest to you. If you do not want us to use your information in this way, please check the relevant box located on the form on which we collect your data (the order form). For more information, see Choices About How We Use and Disclose Your Information.

metadata.title: Privacy Policy | Occams Advisory

content:
We may use the information we have collected from you to enable us to display advertisements to our advertisers’ target audiences. Even though we do not disclose your personal information for these purposes without your consent, if you click on or otherwise interact with an advertisement, the advertiser may assume that you meet its target criteria.
Disclosure of Your Information
We may disclose aggregated information about our users, and information that does not identify any individual, without restriction.
We may disclose personal information that we collect or you provide as described in this privacy policy:
To our subsidiaries and affiliates.
To contractors, service providers, and other third parties we use to support our business and who are bound by contractual obligations to keep personal information confidential and use it only for the purposes for which we disclose it to them.

metadata.title: Privacy Policy | Occams Advisory

content:
To a buyer or other successor in the event of a merger, divestiture, restructuring, reorganization, dissolution, or other sale or transfer of some or all of Occams Advisory’s assets, whether as a going concern or as part of bankruptcy, liquidation, or similar proceeding, in which personal information held by Occams Advisory about our Website users is among the assets transferred.
To third parties to market their products or services to you if you have consented to these disclosures. We contractually require these third parties to keep personal information confidential and use it only for the purposes for which we disclose it to them. For more information, see Choices About How We Use and Disclose Your Information.
To fulfill the purpose for which you provide it.
For any other purpose disclosed by us when you provide the information
With your consent.
We may also disclose your personal information:

metadata.title: Privacy Policy | Occams Advisory

content:
To fulfill the purpose for which you provide it.
For any other purpose disclosed by us when you provide the information
With your consent.
We may also disclose your personal information:
To comply with any court order, law, or legal process, including to respond to any government or regulatory request.
To enforce or apply our terms of use or and other agreements, including for billing and collection purposes.
If we believe disclosure is necessary or appropriate to protect the rights, property, or safety of Occams Advisory, our customers, or others. This includes exchanging information with other companies and organizations for the purposes of fraud protection and credit risk reduction.
Choices About How We Use and Disclose Your Information
We strive to provide you with choices regarding the personal information you provide to us. We have created mechanisms to provide you with the following control over your information:

metadata.title: Privacy Policy | Occams Advisory

content:
We strive to provide you with choices regarding the personal information you provide to us. We have created mechanisms to provide you with the following control over your information:
Tracking Technologies and Advertising. You can set your browser to refuse all or some browser cookies, or to alert you when cookies are being sent. To learn how you can manage your Flash cookie settings, visit the Flash player settings page on Adobe’s website. If you disable or refuse cookies, please note that some parts of this site may then be inaccessible or not function properly.

metadata.title: Privacy Policy | Occams Advisory

content: Disclosure of Your Information for Third-Party Advertising. If you do not want us to share your personal information with unaffiliated or non-agent third parties for promotional purposes, you can opt out by checking the relevant box located on the form on which we collect your data (the order/registration form). You can also always opt out by logging into the Website and adjusting your user preferences in your account profile, by checking or unchecking the relevant boxes or by sending us an email stating your request to Contact provided on our website

metadata.title: Privacy Policy | Occams Advisory

content: Promotional Offers from the Company. If you do not wish to have your contact information used by the Company to promote our own or third parties’ products or services, you can opt out by checking the relevant box located on the form on which we collect your data (the order/registration form) or at any other time by logging into the Website and adjusting your user preferences in your account profile by checking or unchecking the relevant boxes or by sending us an email stating your request to Contact provided on our website. If we have sent you a promotional email, you may send us a return email asking to be omitted from future email distributions

metadata.title: Privacy Policy | Occams Advisory

content:
Targeted Advertising. If you do not want us to use information that we collect or that you provide to us to deliver advertisements according to our advertisers’ target-audience preferences, you can opt out by checking the relevant box located on the form on which we collect your data (the order/registration form) or at any other time by logging into the Website and adjusting your user preferences in your account profile by checking or unchecking the relevant boxes or by sending us an email stating your request to Contact provided on our website.
We do not control third parties’ collection or use of your information to serve interest-based advertising. However, these third parties may provide you with ways to choose not to have your information collected or used in this way. You can opt out of receiving targeted ads from members of the Network Advertising Initiative (“NAI“) on the NAI’s website.
Data Security

metadata.title: Privacy Policy | Occams Advisory

content:
Data Security
We have implemented measures designed to secure your personal information from accidental loss and from unauthorized access, use, alteration, and disclosure. All information you provide to us is stored on our secure servers behind firewalls.
The safety and security of your information also depends on you. Where we have given you (or where you have chosen) a password for access to certain parts of our Website, you are responsible for keeping this password confidential. We ask you not to share your password with anyone. We urge you to be careful about giving out information in public areas of the Website like message boards. The information you share in public areas may be viewed by any user of the Website.

metadata.title: Privacy Policy | Occams Advisory

content:
Unfortunately, the transmission of information via the internet is not completely secure. Although we do our best to protect your personal information, we cannot guarantee the security of your personal information transmitted to our Website. Any transmission of personal information is at your own risk. We are not responsible for circumvention of any privacy settings or security measures contained on the Website.
Changes to Our Privacy Policy
It is our policy to post any changes we make to our privacy policy on this page. If we make material changes to how we treat our users’ personal information, we will notify you by email to the primary email address specified in your account. The date the privacy policy was last revised is identified at the top of the page. You are responsible for ensuring we have an up-to-date active and deliverable email address for you, and for periodically visiting our Website and this privacy policy to check for any changes.
Contact Information

metadata.title: Privacy Policy | Occams Advisory

content:
Contact Information
To ask questions or comment about this privacy policy and our privacy practices, contact us
To register a complaint or concern, please email per the Contact info our website.
